section.title: Choosing how runs
section.p: You can install to run in a number of ways:

li.p: As a desktop application on Windows, Linux, or Mac.

ul.li: As a server-based application on a Unix or Linux server or on Windows NT Terminal Server.

li.p: As a portable application on a USB stick.
Within a browser as a Java Webstart Application.

section.title: Choosing an installer
section.p: You have a choice of installers.

li.p: The native installer for your platform. On Windows and Linux, the native installer can run in unattended mode.
The universal (Java-based) installer on any supported platform.

section.p: The installation packages were checked before publication with an antivirus program to make sure they are not infected with viruses, trojan horses or other malicious software.

section.title: Choosing a license option
section.p: You must obtain and register a license key to run . You can choose from two kinds of license:

ul.li: A named-person license, that can be used by a single person on mutiple computers.
A floating license, that can be used by different people at different times. Only one person can use a floating license at a time.

section.title: Upgrading, transferring, and uninstalling.
section.p: You can also upgrade , transfer a license, or uninstall .
